deli.description: Dean and Felix people-watch at a local deli.
deli.title: Deli

mural1.description: The corner store across the street from us has been painting a new mural for a month or two.  Felix particularly likes the taxicab in it, because he knows what cabs are for:  taking people to the airport!
mural1.title: Mural 1

mural2.description: Nana and Felix check out the details.
mural2.title: Mural 2

mural_neighbor.description: The house next door to us is a bed and breakfast.  It's got a traffic-stopping paint job.   Lots of people take pictures of it.
mural_neighbor.title: Mural Neighbor

mural_vehicle.description: The bed and breakfast has a car that's as colorful as the house.  Notice the trolley on the front fender has itty bitty graffiti on it.
mural_vehicle.title: Mural Vehicle

playdoh_hair.description: New addition to play-doh playtime:  a barber's chair!  Felix is highly amused.
playdoh_hair.title: Playdoh Hair

playground1.description: The Moses family hangs out at a playground.
playground1.title: Playground 1

playground3.description: Is Felix going to play with Nana or go solo?
playground3.title: Playground 3

walk1.description: Everyone lines up for a funny walk.
walk1.title: Walk 1

walk2.description: Felix takes lot of pleasure in walking.  He stomps his feet, walks on his tippy-toes, waves his arms and does little sing-song chants.
walk2.title: Walk 2

description:
Nana was in town this weekend. She and Felix really enjoyed hanging out. And Dean and Lucie really enjoyed going out. Lucie's birthday was Friday the 20th; we went with friends to a club and shot pool, something we haven't done in quite a while.

Felix is getting more high-energy. He jumps around more, makes more loud noises, wrestles Dean with more ferocity and tenacity, and gets more bruises from falling and knocking into things. He's good about brushing off a fall and getting back to what he was doing. Now when people ask "how's your baby?", it's hard to connect it with Felix. Felix is a little boy.

On the language front, he says "sorry" and "cool!"

On the discipline front, on the very infrequent occasions we give him a time out, he has the self restraint to sit in the chair himself (with one of us watching) rather than having to be held there.
title: February 22
